required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity and Safety Study in Infants of GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals' Infanrix Hexa™ (DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib) Vaccine
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity and Safety Study of GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals' Infanrix Hexa™ Vaccine in Healthy Infants in India

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the immunogenicity and safety of Infanrix hexa™ (DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib) when administered as a primary vaccination course to Indian infants according to a 6-10-14 weeks or a 2-4-6 months schedule.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Diphteria (D) and Tetanus (T) Antigens
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with anti-D and anti-T antibody concentration greater than or equal to (≥) 0.1 international units per milliliter (IU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Hepatitis B (HBs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with anti-HBS antibody concentration ≥ 10 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Poliovirus (Polio) Types 1,2,3 Antigens
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a subject with anti-Poliovirus 1,2 and 3 antibody titers ≥ 8 effective dose, for 50% of people receiving the vaccine (ED50).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Polyribosyl-ribitol Phosphate (PRP) Antigens
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a subject with anti-PRP antibody concentration ≥ 0.15 micrograms per milliliter (µg/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Vaccine Response for Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Haemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN)
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as : For initially seronegative subjects (S-), antibody concentration ≥ 5 enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) units per milliliter (EL.U/mL) at 1 month after the third dose; For initially seropositive subjects (S+): antibody concentration at 1 month after the third dose ≥ 1 fold increase in the pre-vaccination antibody concentration.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody concentrations were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in international units per milliliter (IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody concentrations were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody titers were presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody concentrations were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in µg/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody concentrations were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in EL.U/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
secondary_outcome.description: A seropositive subject was defined as a subject with anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations ≥ 5 EL.U/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Polio Type 1, 2 and 3 Antigens
secondary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a subject with anti-Polio type 1, 2 and 3 antibody titers ≥ 8 effective dose, for 50% of people receiving the vaccine (ED50).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN
secondary_outcome.description: A seropositive subject was defined as a subject with anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations ≥ 5 EL.U/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Anti-HBs Antigens
secondary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a subject with anti-HBs antibody concentrations ≥ 10 mIU/mL.
Antibody titers were presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody concentrations were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in EL.U/mL.
Antibody concentrations were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in mIU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses: Up to Month 2 (Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group) or Month 4 (Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = incidence of any particular symptom regardless of intensity grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Solicited General Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses: Up to Month 2 (Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group) or Month 4 (Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and temperature [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of any particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to study vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) post-vaccination period: Up to Month 3 (Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group) or Month 5 (Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group)
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Month 0 up to Month 3 (Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group) or Month 5 (Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group))
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

clinical_study.condition: Diphtheria-Tetanus-aPertussis-Hepatitis B-Poliomyelitis-Haemophilus Influenzae Type b Vaccines

arm_group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All subjects must satisfy ALL the following criteria at study entry:
- A male or female between, and including, 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of the first vaccination
- Documented administration of a hepatitis B vaccine dose at birth
- Subjects who the investigator believes that their parent(s)/legally acceptable representative(s) [LAR(s)] can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol
- Written informed consent obtained from the parent(s)/LAR(s) of the subject
- Healthy subjects as established by medical history and clinical examination before entering into the study
- Born after a gestation period of at least 36 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
The following criteria should be checked at the time of study entry. If ANYexclusion criterion applies, the subject must not be included in the study:
- Child in care
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product other than the study vaccines within 30 days preceding the first dose, or planned use during the study period
- Chronic administration of immunosuppressants or other immune-modifying drugs within six months prior to the first vaccine dose
- Administration of a vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol, within 30 days prior to the first study visit, or planned administration during the study period, with the exception of oral human rotavirus (HRV) vaccination which is allowed at any time during the study
- Concurrently participating in another clinical study, at any time during the study period, in which the subject has been or will be exposed to an investigational or a non-investigational product
- Evidence of previous diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, hepatitis B, poliomyelitis and Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccination or disease, with the exception of a birth dose of hepatitis B vaccine and oral poliovirus vaccine (OPV) as per local standard of care
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition, based on medical history and physical examination
- Family history of congenital or hereditary immunodeficiency
- History of any reaction or hypersensitivity likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine
- Major congenital defects or serious chronic illness
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products since birth or planned administration during the study period
- Acute disease and/or fever at the time of enrolment

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

reference.citation: Lalwani SK et al. (2016) Immunogenicity and safety of 3-dose primary vaccination with combined DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib in Indian infants. Hum Vaccin Immunother. 15:0. [Epub ahead of print].

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD is available via the Clinical Study Data Request site (click on the link provided below)
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: IPD is available via the Clinical Study Data Request site (click on the link provided below)
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access is provided after a research proposal is submitted and has received approval from the Independent Review Panel and after a Data Sharing Agreement is in place. Access is provided for an initial period of 12 months but an extension can be granted, when justified, for up to another 12 months.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During the screening the following steps occurred: check for inclusion/exclusion criteria, contraindications/precautions, medical history of the subjects and signing informed consent forms.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized

outcome.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Diphteria (D) and Tetanus (T) Antigens
outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with anti-D and anti-T antibody concentration greater than or equal to (≥) 0.1 international units per milliliter (IU/mL).
outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, including all evaluable subjects for whom data was available for the considered timepoint and assay assessed.

group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Vaccine Response for Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Haemagglutinin (FHA) and Pertactin (PRN)
outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as : For initially seronegative subjects (S-), antibody concentration ≥ 5 enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) units per milliliter (EL.U/mL) at 1 month after the third dose; For initially seropositive subjects (S+): antibody concentration at 1 month after the third dose ≥ 1 fold increase in the pre-vaccination antibody concentration.
outcome.time_frame: One month post Dose 3 (Month 3 or Month 5)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, including all evaluable subjects for whom data was available for the considered timepoint and assay assessed and for whom pre-vaccination data was available for the considered assay.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group

measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, including all evaluable subjects for whom data was available for the considered timepoint and assay assessed and for whom pre-vaccination data was available for the considered assay.

group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

measure.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects Against Polio Type 1, 2 and 3 Antigens
measure.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a subject with anti-Polio type 1, 2 and 3 antibody titers ≥ 8 effective dose, for 50% of people receiving the vaccine (ED50).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, including all evaluable subjects for whom data was available for the considered timepoint and assay assessed.

outcome.title: Number of Seropositive Subjects for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN
outcome.description: A seropositive subject was defined as a subject with anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN antibody concentrations ≥ 5 EL.U/mL.
outcome.time_frame: At Month 0
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, including all evaluable subjects for whom data was available for the considered timepoint and assay assessed.

measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, including all evaluable subjects for whom data was available for the considered timepoint and assay assessed.

measure.title: Anti-HBs Antibody Concentrations
measure.description: Antibody concentrations were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in mIU/mL.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, including all evaluable subjects for whom data was available for the considered timepoint and assay assessed.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = incidence of any particular symptom regardless of intensity grade.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses: Up to Month 2 (Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group) or Month 4 (Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects who received at least one dose of the study vaccine, for whom data were available and who had the symptoms sheet filled in.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = incidence of any particular symptom regardless of intensity grade.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects who received at least one dose of the study vaccine, for whom data were available and who had the symptoms sheet filled in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Solicited General Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and temperature [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of any particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to study vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses: Up to Month 2 (Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group) or Month 4 (Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects who received at least one dose of the study vaccine, for whom data were available and who had the symptoms sheet filled in.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Solicited General Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and temperature [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of any particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to study vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects who received at least one dose of the study vaccine, for whom data were available and who had the symptoms sheet filled in.

class.title: Any Loss of appetite, Across doses

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) post-vaccination period: Up to Month 3 (Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group) or Month 5 (Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects who received at least one dose of the study vaccine and for whom data were available.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects who received at least one dose of the study vaccine and for whom data were available.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Month 0 up to Month 3 (Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group) or Month 5 (Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group))
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects who received at least one dose of the study vaccine and for whom data were available.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all subjects who received at least one dose of the study vaccine and for whom data were available.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited symptoms: during the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period. Unsolicited AEs: during the 31-day (Days 0-30) post-vaccination period. SAEs: during the entire study period (from Month 0 to Month 3 or Month 5).

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 6-10-14 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 6, 10 and 14 weeks of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

group.title: Infanrix Hexa 2-4-6 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged between and including 6 and 10 weeks of age at the time of first vaccination, who received 3 doses of Infanrix hexa™ vaccine at 2, 4 and 6 months of age, administered intramuscularly in the right side of the thigh.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
